content:
Diagnosis:	Medullary thyroid carcinoma

Management:	12 Jan 2024 Total thyroidectomy with central and right lateral neck dissection
		15 Feb 2024 Commenced Cabozantinib 60mg daily

Histology:	pT2N1M0 medullary thyroid carcinoma with 4/18 positive lymph nodes in right lateral neck

Current Situation:	Treatment review - 8 weeks on Cabozantinib

I reviewed [redacted name] today following 8 weeks of treatment with Cabozantinib for medullary thyroid cancer. The response to treatment has been encouraging, with the most recent calcitonin showing a significant decrease from 600 pg/mL pre-treatment to 180 pg/mL. The patient's neck ultrasound performed last week demonstrates reduction in size of the residual right level IV lymph nodes, with the largest node decreasing from 2.1cm to 1.4cm.

Treatment tolerance has been challenging but manageable. The patient developed grade 2 palmar-plantar erythrodysesthesia in week 4, which improved to grade 1 with dose reduction to 40mg daily and implementation of supportive measures. There is also mild fatigue and intermittent diarrhea, well controlled with loperamide as needed. Blood pressure has remained stable on amlodipine 5mg daily, which was started prophylactically at treatment initiation.

Current thyroid function shows good biochemical control on levothyroxine 150mcg daily. The most recent TSH was 0.8 mU/L (range 0.4-4.0). Liver function tests and other biochemistry remain within normal range.

On examination today, there is no palpable cervical lymphadenopathy. The surgical scar is well-healed. Blood pressure is 138/82 mmHg.

The plan is to continue Cabozantinib at the current dose of 40mg daily. We will repeat calcitonin and thyroid function tests in 4 weeks, with the next CT scan scheduled for early May to formally assess response. I will review the patient again in clinic in 4 weeks with these results.
